translation.title: The Exterior and What’s Not-Self in the Three Times

previous.name: The Exterior and What’s Suffering in the Three Times

segments.en: 219–221. The Exterior and What’s Not-Self in the Three Times
“Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts are not-self.

segments.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
segments.en: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ …”

segments.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights,…
